intro: Calandrinia sanguinea, commonly known as the red-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and clusters of vibrant red, pink, or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Calandrinia sanguinea is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
